history.content:
You can take 189 and 182 concurrently in the Spring; I'm taking it concurrently right now and the only prerequisite knowledge from 189 that 182 assumes are simple things like SVMs, Linear/Logistic Regression, Bias-Variance Tradeoff that are either covered during the first 3-4 weeks of 189, or covered in other classes like 127 and Data 100. 

I enjoy 182; the class covers a variety of topics, including topics from Computer Vision, NLP and Reinforcement Learning. I wouldn't say that it's absolutely essential for a career in ML though; it's more like a "survey class" and we don't go too deep into the mathematical aspects of models that we learn, but we rather explore new, state-of-the-art models/architectures in Deep Learning. Also, the assignments are pretty cool.

---

182 is not crucial. The lectures are not amazing and the homeworks are copied in their entirety from Stanford CS231N, 224N(?) and CS294-112 at Cal. I would recommend doing 162 instead.

You can take 189 and 182 concurrently in the Spring; I'm taking it concurrently right now and the only prerequisite knowledge from 189 that 182 assumes are simple things like SVMs, Linear/Logistic Regression, Bias-Variance Tradeoff that are either covered during the first 3-4 weeks of 189, or covered in other classes like 127 and Data 100. 

I enjoy 182; the class covers a variety of topics, including topics from Computer Vision, NLP and Reinforcement Learning. I wouldn't say that it's absolutely essential for a career in ML though; it's more like a "survey class" and we don't go too deep into the mathematical aspects of models that we learn, but we rather explore new, state-of-the-art models/architectures in Deep Learning. Also, the assignments are pretty cool.

Hi, I am trying to gauge how important CS 182 is for a career in ML. It appears to be only offered in the Spring, and I will be graduating in Fall 2020. I could take 189 in the Fall (without 126), then take 182 in the Spring. Or I could take 126 (maybe with Math 110) in the Fall, then 189 in the Spring, missing 182 entirely. Which one of these options would be better preparation for a career / research in ML? Thanks.
history.subject: Importance of CS 182
